text.autoconfig.ElytraAeronautics.title: Elytra Aeronautics' Configuration Screen
text.autoconfig.ElytraAeronautics.option: ➤ Hold above here for important info about this screen.
- Any changes you make to the configuration using the screen will override all other settings, even if they are not related to the ones you changed.
- It is recommended that you use the screen to experiment and learn, but ultimately you should use the config command to configure if you want more specific behaviors.

- If you are playing a multiplayer game on LAN, only the host player can change the flight settings using this screen. However, this rule does not apply to the config command, which can be used by a player with operator permissions.

- If you are playing on a dedicated multiplayer server, changes made using this screen will not apply. In this case, the config command must be used either from the server console or by a player with operator permissions in-game.
Set to true in order to make elytra flight faster at higher altitudes.
If set to false, flight speed will be determined by the minimal speed setting.
Minimal flight speed achieved by travelling at a zero degree angle.
The default value is the vanilla value.
Maximum flight speed achieved by travelling at a zero degree angle.
Altitude at which flight speed starts to increase.
Altitude at which flight speed stops to increase.
When true, sneaking mid-flight will realign your pitch.
Pitch angle at which the player will align towards when sneaking mid-flight.
Amount of rotation in angle-degrees-per-tick, at which the player will realign towards the "pitch realignment angle".
➤ Hold above here for important info about this screen.
- Any changes you make to the configuration using the screen will override all other settings, even if they are not related to the ones you changed.
- It is recommended that you use the screen to experiment and learn, but ultimately you should use the config command to configure if you want more specific behaviors.
- Cloud configuration is specific to each player and cannot be seen by other players. Your clouds will not appear to other players, and their clouds will not appear to you.
- This screen changes all of your cloud layers at once. If you want to modify each layer separately, you should use the config command.
- You can save cloud layer presets you like or share them with friends by accessing the /config/ElytraAeronautics/cloud_layers.json file.
Whether the faces of clouds are in different tones of the cloud's color in order to simulate shading.
Setting this to false makes clouds monochromatic, which might be better to visualize colored clouds.
command.error.value: Invalid or missing value for the selected attribute.
